news_header: Tanzanian President Samia Suluhu Hassan warns African leaders about the consequences of failing to resolve the conflict in eastern DRC, emphasizing the humanitarian crisis and the need for diplomatic solutions.
news_original_title: Leaders across Africa call for end to DR Congo conflict
news_text: At an emergency summit in Tanzania, President Samia Suluhu Hassan of Tanzania warned African leaders that history will judge them if they fail to end the conflict in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC). The summit addressed the escalating violence, humanitarian crisis, and economic disruptions caused by the conflict. Leaders from the East African Community (EAC) and Southern African Development Community (SADC) called for a ceasefire and resumption of dialogue, emphasizing that military solutions are inadequate. The situation has led to significant loss of life and displacement, with calls for political honesty and inspiration from past peace efforts.
